title: The North Face Presents: FIRST DESCENTS
description: Join us for two exhilarating films presented by The North Face and sponsored by Pikes Peak Alpine School. Travel from the Himalayas to The Great Trango Towers — featuring LHOTSE (2019) and TRANGO (2025). Food and drinks from Ivywild School establishments are welcome.

title: PEAK FILM FORUM — Show Us Your Shorts!
description: FREE and open to the public. This month we will present new films by independent filmmakers including Hadyn Winston, Jesse Pacheco & Catalina Dominick, Daniel Selk, Melissa Peltier, Josh Lindquist, and more!

title: The Colorado Premier of A Higher Power
description: Get ready for a new Chicano classic!.

title: BLACK GOLD
description: Black Gold follows the lives of four men as they reconnect and reclaim their stories. Presented at The Bug Theatre.

title: UCK Movie
description: In the small, sleepy town of Roswad, there’s only one carpet cleaner, named Henryand Henry’s been shampooing up a lot of strange spots, which really shouldn’t be cleaned.

title: Devil In The Trunk
description: This neo-western horror/thriller weaves tension, mystery and moral ambiguity into a relentless pursuit across the desolate highways of the American West. When a young woman, burdened by the weight of her father’s failing roadside garage, crosses paths with a mysterious woman driving a rundown 1968 Chevy Caprice, she is caught up in a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with only one rule: DON’T OPEN THE TRUNK. To keep up with the latest developments be sure to follow @devilinthetrunk.

title: Urchin
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description: Urchin — On the streets of London, Mike is hustling to get by. Roadside evangelizers won’t let him sleep in peace, his slippery friend won’t pay up the money he stole, and before long, he finds himself in trouble with the law.

title: Timestamp
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description: Keeping schools open in Ukraine is an attempt to recreate at least some of the normal life they had before the war — until February 24, 2022 (and in some regions even earlier, in 2014). Without interviews, narration and reenactments, TIMESTAMP provides an insight into how the war is affecting the daily lives of students and teachers.

title: Science on Screen®: Fungal Frequencies
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description: Science on Screen®: Fungal Frequencies launches the Dairy Arts Center’s exploration of fungi as creative collaborators through movement film, and scientific discovery. This evening brings together artists, scientists, and short film to explore how fungi inspire new forms of artistic expression and ways of seeing.

title: Monkey Wrench Films presents “Preserved”
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description:
Preserved takes viewers inside Vermejo—a 558,000-acre living laboratory where mountain lions, bears, and countless other species reveal how wildlife is adapting in a changing world. The film spotlights the stewards working to restore this landscape—and why what happens here matters everywhere. The planet can heal. It starts with us.

Featuring exclusive performance by musician MILCK and a panel discussion with: Craig Childs, Colorado author and Southwest expert; Erin Sprague, CEO Protect Our Winters; Bob Dineen, CEO Great Range Bison; Lance Bernal, Vermejo National Resources Manager; Louis Wertz, Western Landowners Alliance; Ben Clark, Director of Preserved.

title: You Got Gold: A Celebration of John Prine
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description: Filmed in October 2022 at Nashville’s Ryman Auditorium, this movie captures a star-studded tribute to the legendary songwriter, . The event brought together acclaimed artists, friends, and family to share behind-the-scenes stories and perform classic songs, honoring Prine’s enduring legacy. Prine, widely celebrated as one of history’s greatest songwriters, captivated millions of fans and earned the admiration of icons such as Bonnie Raitt, Brandi Carlile, Tyler Childers, Lucinda Williams, Dwight Yoakam, Jason Isbell, and Bob Weir, amongst many others, are featured in the film performing on the Ryman stage for this special celebration of his life and music. (Michael John Warren, 2025, USA, 1:30, NR)

title: Cactus Pears
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description: Anand, a 30-something city dweller compelled to spend a 10-day mourning period for his father in the rugged countryside of western India, tenderly bonds with a local farmer who is struggling to stay unmarried. As the mourning ends, forcing his return, Anand must decide the fate of his relationship born under duress. Winner, Grand Jury Prize (World Dramatic), Sundance Film Festival. (Rohan Kanawade,2025, India, 1:52, NR)

title: Anchor Point Film Tour
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description: The Anchor Point Tour is a celebration of the fearless spirit and artistry of highlining documentaries. Our festival is dedicated to sharing all stories—big or small—that showcase the passion, creativity, and boundary-pushing endeavors of athletes within our community. Through this event we want to uplift all parts of our community and use a portion off the revenue to provide gear to underrepresented communities. Doors open at 5:30pm.

title: Obex
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description: In pre-internet 1987, Conor and his dog Sandy live a life of seclusion, lost in the slow-rendering graphics of early Macs and televisions aglow with late night horror movie marathons. But when he begins playing OBEX, a new and mysterious, state-of-the-art computer game, he finds himself trapped in a low-tech, but high-stakes analog hellscape as the line between reality and game blurs. Audacious and uncanny, writer-director Albert Birney’s OBEX is a delightfully skewed lo-fi fantasy. Shot in striking black and white, this surreally nostalgic nightmare revisits the dawn of personal computing to reflect on the loneliness of our always-online present day. (Albert Birney, 2025, USA, 1:30, NR)

title: Classics with Jeffrey Kash: The Pajama Game
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description: Doris Day stars in this lighthearted look at labor problems in a pajama factory. It features Bob Fosse choreography, and the Jerry Ross-Richard Adler score includes “Hey There,” “Steam Heat,” “Small Talk,” “Hernando’s Hideaway” and “Her Is.” (George Abbott & Stanley Donen, 1957, USA, 1:41, NR)

title: The Little Things That Run the World
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description:
Insects were the first animals to evolve flight nearly 440 million years ago, and they survived all five of the known mass extinctions since then. They have also been called the “glue of life” on Earth; they literally hold ecosystems together. But, there is evidence that the pace of decline among insects in parts of the world today is fast approaching the levels of previous catastrophes.

What does this mean for the rest of life on Earth, including humans? What is causing this extinction crisis? What can be done to reverse the trend? Our new release The Little Things That Run the World introduces viewers to a diverse group of scientists, nature lovers, gardeners, farmers, and general bug enthusiasts in exploring the importance of flying insects amid rapid declines in their numbers. The film documents the mysteries of the declines alongside creative and heroic human efforts to change the course of evolutionary history. (Doug Hawes-Davis, 2025, USA, 1:45, NR)

title: No Other Choice
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description: From director Park Chan-wook and based on Donald E. Westlake’s novel THE AX, the story follows Man-su on his desperate hunt for a new job after his abrupt layoff from the paper company he served for 25 years. He devises a unique plan to secure a new job: eliminate his competition. (Park Chan-wook, 2025, South Korea, 2:19, R)

title: Radu Jude’s Dracula
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description: A frustrated filmmaker, facing creative paralysis, turns to an A.I. chatbot in order to make his latest movie a hit. The result is a series of increasingly outrageous vignettes exploring the myth of Dracula in all its forms. From a wild chase through the streets of modern Transylvania to eerie hauntings in the Romanian countryside, cinematic provocateur Radu Jude returns with another boundary-pushing epic featuring a union-busting Dracula breaking a strike, an adaptation of the first Romanian vampire novella, thwarted romance, fields of phalluses, lots of blood, and much more. (Radu Jude, 2025, Romania, 2:50, NR).

title: Pieowa: A Piece of America
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description: PIEOWA celebrates the myriad ways pie is woven into Iowa’s (and America’s) culture, the lengths people will go to for a slice, and how this humble pastry can bake the world a better place. The film features comedian Tom Arnold, NPR economics correspondent Scott Horsley (NPR = No Pie Refused), Better Homes & Gardens food editor, among other notable names, alongside everyday people — church ladies, farm wives, pie shop owners, State Fair competitors, chefs, food historians, bike riders, and humanitarians. Wholesome and humorous, it will leave you feeling more hopeful about the world — and hungry for pie. (Beth M. Howard, 2025, USA, 1:16, NR)

title: For The Living
venue: The Dairy Arts Center — 2590 Walnut, Boulder, CO
description: For centuries, Humankind has grappled with the tension between the two extremes of our nature: Dehumanization and Empathy. Darkness and Light. From the genocide of Indigenous peoples of the western hemisphere to the horrors of the Holocaust to the genocides in Bosnia and Rwanda we realize that numbers make us numb. The more who die, the less we care. But, in 2019 another journey from darkness to light called “Ride for the Living” offered a way forward. Originating at the universal symbol of absolute evil (Auschwitz-Birkenau) 250 cyclists from 12 different countries came together to re-trace the WWII liberation path of a single 10-year Holocaust survivor across the Polish countryside to reach a destination symbolizing our common humanity: Krakow, Poland. Alternating between the intimate story of this one Holocaust survivor and the startling similarities among individuals in all genocides, these parallel journeys bring to life how we can grow our empathy to encompass millions. And how the American educational system has long overlooked—and in 2025 now threatens to whitewash–these stories and the insights we need to prevent future genocides. Inciting the urgent conversation: When will we stop building monuments for the Dead and get busy re-humanizing the Living? When will we finally say NEVER AGAIN and truly mean it? (Marc Bennett & Tim Roper, 2024, USA, 1:57, NR).

title: The Voice of Hind Rajab
description: January 29, 2024. Red Crescent volunteers receive an emergency call. A 6-year old girl is trapped in a car under fire in Gaza, pleading for rescue. While trying to keep her on the line, they do everything they can to get an ambulance to her. Her name was Hind Rajab. The film recreates real events using actual audio recordings of the phone call. This Venice Silver Lion Grand Jury Prize winning film from twice Oscar-nominated filmmaker Kaouther Ben Hania is already being listed among the top 5 likely Oscar nominees for Best International Feature. (Kaouther Ben Hania, 2025, Tunisia, 1:29, NR)

title: The Choral
description: As war rages on the Western Front, the Choral Society in Ramsden, Yorkshire has lost most of its men to the army. The Choral’s ambitious committee, determined to press ahead, decides to recruit local young males to swell their ranks. They must also engage a new chorus master, and despite their suspicions that he has something to hide, their best bet seems to be Dr. Henry Guthrie (Ralph Fiennes) – driven, uncompromising, and recently returned from a career in Germany. As conscription papers start to arrive, the whole community discovers that the best response to the chaos that is laying waste to their lives is to make music together. (Nicholas Hytner, 2025, UK, 1:53, R)

title: The Cathedral of New Emotions
description: A psychedelic odyssey through animation with visuals that’ll melt your mental highways, THE CATHEDRAL OF NEW EMOTIONS is a surreal German film that’s truly out of this world. The story follows a group of Berlin intellectuals and stoners as they escape from the terrors and troubles of 1970s Earth in their giant hand spaceship. As time passes and ennui sets in, the zonked-out crew decides to search for the man who convinced them to flee to the stars in the first place. Thrillingly original, gorgeously stylized, and recently made available after years of obscurity, this marvel is ready to takey ou on a journey to places beyond imagination. (Helmut Herbst, 2006, Germany, 1:00, NR)

title: Boulder Environmental Nature Outdoors Film Festival: The Road To Patagonia
description:
The Road to Patagonia is a stunning, intimate and unflinching series of love letters within a documentary – firstly a love between two people, and secondly between humanity and the Earth. We follow Matty Hannon on an incredible solo adventure, to surf the west coast of the Americas by motorbike, from the top of Alaska to the tip of Patagonia. But deep in the wilderness – alone with the wolves and the bears – the journeyer’s plans unexpectedly fall to pieces. After losing everything, and on the cusp of quitting he meets the girl of his dreams, a permaculture farmer named Heather Hillier who throws caution to the wind and sells her urban-farm to buy a bike of her own. Together riding south, the duo meet with Zapatista rebels, Amazonian shamans and Mapuche leaders whose salient words crack the adventurers’ cultural veneer, leaving them with existential questions.

The 50,000km surfing odyssey becomes beautifully complicated by their decision to downshift from motorcycles to horseback, presenting a relational approach to the breathtaking landscapes and a host of challenges that ultimately become extremely rewarding. Hannon and Hillier succeed in beautifully capturing deeply human moments during the world-first expedition, and the noticeable lack of camera-crew becomes The Road to Patagonia’s strength. The theme of deep ecology underpins the entire film, visually communicated through exquisite cinematography and emotional verité sequences. Shot over 16 years, the result is an adventurous exposé on the more-than-human world, offering a physical and spiritual odyssey to better understand our place in Nature.

Winner – Best Film and Best Documentary – Byron Bay International Film Festival

Winner – Audience Choice Award – Florida Surf Film Festival

Winner – Audience Choice Award – Melbourne Documentary Film Festival

Winner – Jury Award – Honolulu Surf Film Festival

Year: 2024

Filmmaker: Matty Hannon

Runtime: 90 minutes

PRODUCTION

10 years

WORLD PREMIERE

Byron Bay International F.F.

Presented by the Boulder Environmental Nature Outdoors Film Festival AND DAIRY ARTS CENTER.

title: 999: The Forgotten Girls
description: In partnership with the Boulder Jewish Community Center. This documentary film is based on an international best-selling book. 999 Slovak girls ordered to register for government service are secretly deported on the first Jewish transport to Auschwitz. This chronicles the untold story of these mostly teenage girls betrayed by their government. Told that by volunteering for “work” they would fulfill their patriotic duty, these innocent young women willingly bid their families farewell. Under the cloak of deceit, they were transported on a one-way ticket to Auschwitz. The few who survived endured more than three years in the death camp. Meet the last living survivors of the First Jewish Transport and learn their story. (Beatriz M.Calleja & Heather Dune Macadam, 2025, 1:30, USA, NR) We will be joined by the director and author Heather Dune Macadam at a reception before the screening and for a talk-back after the screening.

title: Whispers of the Soul: Documentary Screening with Dr. Thomas E. Lockhart
description: Whispers of the Soul: The Legacy of Dr. Thomas E. Lockhart is a featured episode from the documentary series Art Titans: Masters of the New Era, a visionary project directed by acclaimed art world figures Alan Grimandi and Viviana Puello. The series chronicles the journeys of ten master artists whose practices are shaping the contemporary art landscape, offering intimate portraits that explore creative process, cultural impact, and the evolving role of artists in society. Kicking off Black History Month at the Dairy Arts Center, this special event also serves as a precursor to the upcoming exhibition Black Futures in Art (opening February 20), in which Dr. Thomas E. Lockhart III will be one of the exhibiting artists. The screening centers on Dr. Thomas E. Lockhart III, a celebrated realist painter whose work captures the essence of his subjects with precision, grace, and emotional depth. Moving beyond representation, Lockhart’s practice engages in powerful social commentary, exploring themes of history, identity, and collective consciousness. His work invites viewers to question, confront, and reconsider both personal and societal narratives. Following the screening, guests are invited to stay for an artist talk and Q&A with Dr. Thomas E. Lockhart III, offering deeper insight into his creative practice, influences, and artistic vision.

title: Science on Screen® You Can't Miss What You Forget
description: Science on Screen® You Can’t Miss What You Forget Digital Memory and the Trouble with Letting Go What happens when we try to move on, but our data won’t let us? Following Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, Dr. Anthony T. Pinter explores how our online “data shadows” preserve relationships, identities, and memories long after they’ve ended. As our lives change, the data that represents us often doesn’t, leaving behind digital versions of ourselves that no longer fit who we are now. The potential for incongruence between us and our online “data shadows” can be problematic during life transitions, or moments where our identities change significantly (e.g., coming out, dying, becoming a parent, amongst others). We may move on, but our data shadows follow; resurfacing data to make recommendations and encouraging us to reminisce. Much like sorting through the physical objects of sentimental value, our data must also be considered in the aftermath of life transitions; some want to delete everything, others prefer to keep and revisit it. Drawing from research on romantic breakups and digital identity, this talk looks at how people decide what to do with the data left behind after a relationship ends. From the framework of two curatorial philosophies – the archivist and revisionist – Dr. Pinter will discuss how people make decisions about what to do with their data, how they enact those decisions, and how to contend with the algorithmic curator. Blending themes of memory, loss, and control, this Science on Screen conversation asks a deceptively simple question: in a world where forgetting isn’t entirely up to us, what does it really mean to let go? Introduction & film screening: 1:00 PM; Scientific Lecture 3:00 PM

title: Creative Connections: Elvis Sing-Along and Screening of Viva Las Vegas
description: Join us for an afternoon of music, memories, and movie fun – this time celebrating the one and only Elvis Presley. We’ll start with a live pianist leading an Elvis-themed sing-along, followed by a private screening of Viva Las Vegas (1964) on the big screen. This free event is part of the Dairy Arts Center’s Creative Connections Series, designed to bring older adults together through shared arts experiences that inspire joy and connection. Schedule: 12:00–12:45 PM – Elvis Sing-Along (Dairy Lobby) 1:00–2:30 PM – Viva Las Vegas Screening (Boedecker Theater) In partnership with Circle of Care Project Mobilizing the Arts and Culture to Enrich the Lives of Older Adults

title: BETC: Fireflies
description: A Valentine’s outing featuring champagne, roses, and Matthew Barber’s romantic comedy, Fireflies. Eleanor Bannister is a retired school teacher and a model of respectability. She lives a quiet and lonely life until Abel Brown comes to town. A handyman and drifter, the smooth-talking Brown does more than fix Eleanor’s roof. The town begins to talk. Can Abel be trusted?

title: Daughtering
description: In “Daughtering,” three generations of women navigate living, dying and the dead when they are called home to appease unruly spirits. Sixteen to seventy-something, each carries her own idea of what it means to be a daughter: caregiver, rebel, keeper of the stories, breaker of the cycle. Over the course of three charged days and nights, the daughters navigate relationship, grief, and the business of the old house that contains them, alive in its own way with memory and an impressive population of mice. What unfolds is a darkly humorous, emotionally resonant exploration of identity, inheritance and the universal work of becoming who we are, despite (and because of) where we come from. The play culminates in DIY ceremony and catharsis – as tender, fierce and complicated as daughtering itself.

title: 20th Anniversary of the Fly Fishing Film Tour
description: The Fly Fishing Film Tour (F3T) is proud to celebrate its 20th anniversary in 2026, marking two decades of unforgettable stories, breathtaking landscapes, and a community bound by a passion for fly fishing. This milestone year promises to be a landmark event, as the tour kicks off with a fresh collection of the finest fly fishing films from across the globe. This year's lineup dives deeper than ever, spotlighting wild places, inspiring conservation stories, and the dedicated individuals who live and breathe fly fishing. Whether you're a lifelong angler or new to the sport, the 2026 tour delivers a cinematic journey that's sure to cast a lasting impression. Presented by: Skwala, Yeti, Costa

title: Armour of God
description: An adventurer (Jackie Chan) and his friend (Alan Tam) aid a woman (Rosamund Kwan) kidnapped by cultists seeking a set of armor with mystical powers. (Hong Kong, Yugoslavia, Austria, 1986, in Cantonese, 97 min)

title: The Mystery of Chess Boxing
description: New restoration from RZA and Dan Halstead. (Hong Kong, 1979, Mandarin w/ English subtitles, Color, 90 min, 2.35:1)

title: Infernal Affairs
description: Idealistic police cadet Chan Wing-Yan (Tony Leung) is recruited by Police Superintendent Wong (Anthony Wong) to go deep undercover as a member of the criminal Triad society. Into the same cadet class, crime boss Hon Sam (Eric Tsang) installs new Triad member Lau Kin Ming (Andy Lau) to become a long-term mole for the gang. A decade later, both have risen through the ranks in their respective aliases -- but when both of their covers are in danger of being blown, a game of life and death ensues. (Hong Kong, 2002, in Cantonese, Mandarin, Thai, 101 min)

Women enter and exit a science fiction author's life over the course of a few years after the author loses the woman he considers his one true love. (Germany, Hong Kong, China, France, Italy, 2004, in Japanese, English, Mandarin, Cantonese, 128 min)

title: My Darling Clementine
description: In the middle of a long cattle drive, Wyatt Earp (Henry Fonda) and his brothers stop off for a night in the town of Tombstone. The next morning they find their cattle stolen, and one of the brothers is dead. Earp suspects the Clanton family, owners of the O.K. Corral, but wants his revenge to be legal. Film discussion led by Boulder Film Critic Michael Casey. (USA, 1946, in English, French, Spanish, 97 min)

title: Roofman
description: Based on an unbelievable true story, Roofman follows Jeffrey Manchester (Channing Tatum), an Army veteran and struggling father who turns to robbing McDonald's restaurants by cutting holes in their roofs, earning him the nickname: Roofman. Director Derek Cianfrance in person. (USA, 2025, in English, 126 min)

title: One Battle After Another
description: Bob is a washed-up revolutionary who lives in a state of stoned paranoia, surviving off-grid with his spirited and self-reliant daughter, Willa. When his evil nemesis resurfaces and Willa goes missing, the former radical scrambles to find her as both father and daughter battle the consequences of their pasts. Editor Andy Jurgensen in person. (USA, 2025, in English, Spanish, Telugu, 162 min)

title: Sentimental Value
description: Sisters Nora and Agnes reunite with their estranged father, the charismatic Gustav, a once-renowned director who offers stage actress Nora a role in what he hopes will be his comeback film. When Nora turns it down, she soon discovers he has given her part to an eager young Hollywood star. (Turkey, Norway, France, Denmark, Sweden, Germany, UK, 2025, in English, Danish, Norwegian, Swedish, 133 min)

title: The Color of Pomegranates
description: This avant-garde film depicts the life of revered the 18th-century Armenian poet and musician Sayat-Nova (Vilen Galstyan). Portraying events in the life of the artist from childhood up to his death, the movie addresses in particular his relationships with women, including his muse (Sofiko Chiaureli). (Soviet Union, 1969, in Armenian, Azerbaijani, Georgian, 80 min)

title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire
description: In 1770 the young daughter of a French countess develops a mutual attraction to the female artist commissioned to paint her wedding portrait. Sponsored by Department of French & Italian. (France, 2019, in Italian, French, 121 min)

title: Clerks
description: Dante (Brian O'Halloran) is called in to cover a shift at his New Jersey convenience store on his day off. His friend Randal (Jeff Anderson) helps him pass the time, neglecting his video-store customers next door to hang out in the Quick Stop. The uneventful day is disrupted by news that one of Dante's ex-girlfriends has died. (USA, 1994, in English, 92 min)

title: Swiss Army Man
description: Being stranded on a deserted island leaves young Hank (Paul Dano) bored, lonely and without hope. Until he spots a man (Daniel Radcliffe) laying by the shore. Unfortunately, he is dead and quite flatulent. Using the gassy body to his advantage, Hank miraculously makes it back to the mainland with the talking corpse named Manny. (USA, 2016, 97 min)

title: Short Film Tour
description: International Film Series Short Film Tour featuring a selection of short films.

title: π (Pi)
description: A paranoid mathematician searches for a key number that will unlock the universal patterns found in nature. Pushed to his limits, he spirals between brilliance and obsession. (USA, 1998, 84 min)

title: Grizzly Man
description: Werner Herzog's remarkable documentary examines Timothy Treadwell's calling to live among wild grizzly bears on an Alaskan reserve. A devoted conservationist with a passion for adventure, Timothy believed he had bridged the gap between human and beast. (USA, 2005, 103 min)

title: All That's Left of You
description: An epic historical drama chronicling the story of one Palestinian family over three generations, examining the passage of trauma starting with displacement from Jaffa in 1948. (Germany, Cyprus, USA, 2025, 146 min)

title: The Gunfighter
description: Jimmy Ringo (Gregory Peck) is a veteran gunslinger known for being quick on the draw, but his talent inevitably leads to trouble. Film discussion led by Boulder film critic Michael Casey. (USA, 1950, 85 min, 35mm)

title: It Was Just an Accident
description: Vahid, an Azerbaijani auto mechanic, was once imprisoned by Iranian authorities. One day, a man named Eqbal enters his workshop. His prosthetic leg creaks, and Vahid thinks he recognizes one of his former torturers. (Iran, France, Luxembourg, 2025, 103 min)

title: Undercover Brother
description: Blasted from the past and ready to take care of business, 'Undercover Brother' is recruited to infiltrate a sinister underground movement headed by The Man. (USA, 2002, 86 min)

title: Watermelon Man
description: A white insurance salesman, Jeff Gerber (Godfrey Cambridge), gets the surprise of his life when he wakes up and discovers that his skin now resembles a black man's. (USA, 1970, 100 min)

title: IFS Underground #20
description: A 'blacksploitation' flick with the backbone of a horror film. Filled with odd set-pieces, hilariously bad science jargon, and a lumbering menace at the center, this movie might leave you in pieces. Free show!

title: Get Out
description: Chris visits his girlfriend Rose's family for a weekend getaway. At first, he reads the family's overly accommodating behavior as nervous attempts to deal with their daughter's interracial relationship, but a series of disturbing discoveries leads him to a truth he never could have imagined. (USA, 2017, 104 min)

title: Malcolm X
description: A tribute to the controversial black activist and leader of the struggle for black liberation. His assassination in 1965 left a legacy of self-determination and racial pride. (USA, 1992, 202 min)

title: Dreamgirls
description: Deena (Beyoncé Knowles), Effie (Jennifer Hudson) and Lorrell (Anika Noni Rose) form a music trio called the Dreamettes. When ambitious manager Curtis Taylor Jr. (Jamie Foxx) spots the act, he offers the chance of a lifetime. (USA, 2006, 130 min)

title: Blindspotting
description: Collin must make it through his final three days of probation for a chance at a new beginning in his Oakland neighborhood. His bond with his volatile best friend gets tested when Collin sees a police officer shoot a suspect in the back. (USA, 2018, 95 min)

title: Dope
description: High-school senior Malcolm (Shameik Moore) and his friends bond over '90s hip-hop culture. A chance encounter with a drug dealer lands Malcolm with Ecstasy hidden in his backpack. A wild adventure ensues as they try to evade armed thugs. (USA, 2015, 103 min)

title: Fruitvale Station
description: 22-year-old Oscar Grant (Michael B. Jordan) is trying hard to live a clean life. Flashbacks reveal the last day in Oscar's life, in which he became swept up in an altercation with police that ended in tragedy. Based on a true story. (USA, 2013, 82 min)

title: Moodswing Whiskey
description: Leo, a husband, father and businessman, confronts the brutal realities of capitalism as he fights to reclaim what he believes are his inalienable rights. Filmmakers Skinner Myers and Jamal Sledge in person. (77 min)

title: Marlee Matlin: Not Alone Anymore
description: In 1987, Marlee Matlin became the first Deaf actor to win an Academy Award. Reflecting on her life in American Sign Language, Marlee explores the complexities of what it means to be a trailblazer. (USA, 2025, 98 min)

title: No Other Choice (IFS)
description: After being laid off and humiliated by a ruthless job market, a veteran paper mill manager descends into violence in a desperate bid to reclaim his dignity. (South Korea, France, 2025, 139 min)

title: Batman (1966)
description: The Dynamic Duo faces four super-villains who plan to hold the world for ransom with the help of a secret invention that instantly dehydrates people. (USA, 1966, 105 min)

title: Oscar-Nominated Animated Shorts
description: The 2026 Oscar-Nominated Animated Short Films program.

title: IFS Underground #21
description: This film is truly 'out there'! It's ultimately nothing more than a Philippine version of Bond, even down to the characters, the gadgets, the bedding of women in the middle of scenes, and the retro rip-off of John Barry's famous Bond theme tune. From clichéd characters, scene rip-offs from other films, continuity errors, stunt gaffs. It's all there!

title: Oscar-Nominated Live-Action Shorts
description: The 2026 Oscar-Nominated Live-Action Short Films program.

title: Oscar-Nominated Documentary Shorts
description: The 2026 Oscar-Nominated Documentary Short Films program.

title: Kiss Me Deadly
description: One evening, Hammer gives a ride to Christina, an attractive hitchhiker who has escaped from a lunatic asylum. Thugs waylay them and force his car to crash. Hammer decides to pursue the case, both for vengeance and hoping 'something big' is behind it all. (USA, 1955, 106 min)

title: House of Gucci
description: When Patrizia Reggiani, an outsider from humble beginnings, marries into the Gucci family, her unbridled ambition begins to unravel the family legacy and triggers a reckless spiral of betrayal, decadence, revenge, and ultimately… murder. (Canada, USA, 2021, 158 min)

title: The Flamingo
description: A portrait of Mary Phillips, a 60-something divorcee who seeks intimacy, pleasure and freedom after 13 years of celibacy. Filmmaker Adam Sekuler in person. (2024, 77 min)

title: IFS Underground #22
description: A trashy lesbian vampire love story soaked in grime and sex. Utilizing large settings and spaces in NYC, this movie feels bigger than a typical SOV horror feature. Gore effects are surprisingly good with kill scenes sporting arterial squirts, believable makeup appliances, and some shockingly good transformations during feeds. Credited with launching the lesbian vampire boom of the 1990s.

title: Redline
description: A daredevil driver is determined to compete in Redline, the most popular race in the galaxy. The race only occurs every five years, but he must overcome the mafia, the government and even love. (Japan, 2009, 102 min)

title: Jason and the Argonauts
description: Jason, a fearless sailor and explorer, must find the magical Golden Fleece. He embarks on an epic quest fraught with fantastic monsters and terrible perils. (USA, 1963, 104 min)

title: The Tale of Princess Kaguya
description: Found inside a shining stalk of bamboo by an old bamboo cutter, a tiny girl grows rapidly into an exquisite young lady. The mysterious young princess enthralls all who encounter her. But, ultimately, she must confront her fate. (Japan, 2013, 137 min)

title: Boys Go to Jupiter
description: A teenager in suburban Florida desperately hustles to make $5,000 in this dreamy and surreal animated coming-of-age story. (USA, 2025, 87 min)

title: Fantasia
description: Released in 1940, Fantasia represented Disney's boldest experiment to date. Bringing to life his vision of blending animated imagery with classical music. (USA, 1940, 124 min)

title: IFS Underground #23
description: This is claymation cosmic horror that is as impressive as it is downright creepy. Gooey lovecraftian body horror meets Shiraishi's file series. Filled with tons of claymation creature transformations (bugs, aliens, mushroom mutants), miniature bloody eyeballs and beating hearts, tentacles. A very underrated hidden gem. Just an hour of beautifully crafted yet grotesque claymation. It's weird as hell but definitely worth watching.

title: Frankenstein (2025)
description: Dr. Victor Frankenstein, a brilliant but egotistical scientist, brings a creature to life in a monstrous experiment that ultimately leads to the undoing of both the creator and his tragic creation. (USA, Canada, 2025, 150 min)

title: The General
description: During America's Civil War, Union spies steal engineer Johnny Gray's beloved locomotive, 'The General'. Live musical accompaniment by Mont Alto Motion Picture Orchestra. (USA, 1926, 79 min)

title: By Design
description: A woman (Juliette Lewis) swaps bodies with a chair, and everyone likes her better as a chair in a surreal, deadpan comedy from director Amanda Kramer. (USA, 2026, 91 min)

title: Spaceballs
description: When the nefarious Dark Helmet hatches a plan to snatch Princess Vespa and steal her planet's air, space-bum-for-hire Lone Starr and his clueless sidekick fly to the rescue. (USA, 1987, 96 min)

title: All the President's Men
description: Bob Woodward (Robert Redford) and Carl Bernstein (Dustin Hoffman) research the botched 1972 burglary of the Democratic Party Headquarters at the Watergate complex. With Deep Throat's help, they follow the money all the way to the top. (USA, 1976, 138 min)

title: The Toxic Avenger (2025)
description: When a downtrodden janitor is exposed to a catastrophic toxic accident, he's transformed into The Toxic Avenger. Lloyd Kaufman in person; Q&A led by Mathew Klickstein. (USA, 2025, 102 min)

title: Eastern Anthems
description: An unfinished film is passed from one friend to another, invoking both the reflection of a post-pandemic present and our shared future. Filmmakers Matthew Woklow & Jean-Jacques Martinod in person. (Canada, USA, Ecuador, 2024, 76 min)

title: Matti da slegare
description: This documentary makes the point that many inmates now in mental hospitals could be released without harm to society. Discussion panel to follow. (Italy, 1975, 135 min)

title: Reefer Madness
description: High-school principal Dr. Alfred Carroll relates to an audience of parents that marijuana can have devastating effects on teens. A drug supplier entices several restless teens into frequenting a reefer house. (USA, 1938, 66 min)

title: April
description: Nina works as an OB-GYN in a provincial town hospital. When a newborn dies under her supervision, she is accused of wrongdoings. Despite the risks, Nina remains devoted to her duty as a doctor.

title: The Great Dictator
description: A Jewish barber (Charles Chaplin) spends years in an army hospital recovering from wounds, unaware of the rise of fascist dictator Adenoid Hynkel (also Chaplin). The barber, who bears a remarkable resemblance to Hynkel, joins a rebellion. (USA, 1940, 125 min)

title: Labyrinth
description: Sarah (Jennifer Connelly) summons the Goblins to take her baby stepbrother away. When little Toby disappears, Sarah must follow him into a fantastical world to rescue him from the Goblin King (David Bowie). (UK, USA, 1986, 101 min)

title: Festival Cultures Shorts Program
description: A short film program curated by the film festival cultures class at CU. Free show!

title: Half-Life of Memory
venue: Arvada Center for the Arts and Humanities 6901 Wadsworth Blvd.
description: A documentary exploring America's forgotten nuclear weapons factory at Rocky Flats. Features interviews with former workers, FBI whistleblowers, grand jury members, and downwinders affected by the plant's legacy. Directed by Jeff Gipe.

title: Bee Wild
description: An inspirational documentary exploring the foundational role bees play in sustaining humanity, the reasons for their population decline, and how we can regenerate bees worldwide. Featuring Ellie Goulding and Angelina Jolie. Directed by Josh Tickell & Rebecca Tickell. (55 min)

title: Binvasion
description: A mockumentary about recycling bins by a group of young people in Dumfries. A news crew investigate a story of a missing cat and uncover a new life-form! World Premiere. (UK)

title: Build Better Futures
description: A group of at-risk students compete against college engineers to design a sustainable house in an inspiring story that calls for the transformation of the building industry. Colorado Premiere. Directed by Nathan J Havey.

title: Building on the Edge
description: A group of architecture students embark on an epic adventure to design and build a research station in Antarctica. Colorado Premiere. Directed by Mike Scalisi & Bruce Borowsky.

title: Catapults to Cameras
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: Wildlife filmmaker Ashwika Kapur uncovers illegal wildlife hunting in West Bengal and follows five children who become conservation ambassadors. Produced by Roundglass Sustain. (India)

title: Chirp Talker
description: On her city balcony, Audrey invents a bird-language translator that unlocks secret bird conversations. Colorado Premiere. Directed by Audrey He-Qing Cheng. (Taiwan)

title: Chopping Down More Than Trees
description: Explores the hidden impacts of deforestationwhy it happens, effects on animals, how it causes natural disasters, and solutions that have worked around the world. World Premiere.

title: From Sea to Shining Sea
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: The remarkable life of Katharine Lee Bates, poet and social reformer who authored America the Beautiful. Directed by John E de Graaf.

title: Gringo Cofán
description: An intimate portrait of Randy Borman, raised among the Cofán people in the Ecuadorian Amazon, and his fight to protect the rainforest from oil exploitation. Directed by Veronica Moscoso. (Ecuador)

title: Guardians of the Earth
description: In Kenya, indigenous protectors save Africa's wildliferangers, Maasai lion guardians, and Samburu women whose beadwork carries stories of their connection to nature. Colorado Premiere.

title: Guardians of Yellowstone
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: For 35 years, biologists have shaped wildlife research in Yellowstone. This film reveals the hidden lives of cougars as apex predators vital to the ecosystem. Colorado Premiere.

title: The Girl and Her Piano
description: 12-year-old pianist Hillary O'Sullivan travels to Bhutan's highlands at 4,000m with a piano and a message about climate crisis. US Premiere. Directed by Elaine Lim. (Singapore)

title: The HAWK WATCH Documentary
description: Citizen scientists work to protect the Swainson's Hawk migration in Southern California, facing obstacles from aging, climate change, and development. Colorado Premiere.

title: The Human Side of Plastic
description: On Deer Isle, Maine, warming waters and microplastic pollution threaten a lobster port's way of life. Researcher Abby Barrows offers a vision for plastic-free aquaculture. Colorado Premiere.

title: The Invisible Mammal
description: An all-woman team of biologists save bats from deadly fungal disease. When COVID-19 interrupts, they discover connections between bat conservation and infectious disease. Directed by Kristin Tieche.

title: The Light Won't Dim
description: A 30-minute documentary exploring solar power's promise. From Puerto Rico post-Hurricane Maria to NYC schools. Featuring Bernie Sanders and Bill McKibben. Directed by Jackson Hyland-Lipski.

title: The Little Things that Run the World
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: Scientists and bug enthusiasts explore the importance of flying insects amid rapid population declines. Three quarters of all species are insectsthe 'glue of life' on Earth. Colorado Premiere.

title: The Rewilders
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: Pioneering conservationists on three continents work to restore jaguar, elephant, bison and Pacific salmon. Colorado Premiere. Directed by Marlene Rodgers. (Canada)

title: The Voice of Plants
description: An 8-minute mockumentary where scientist Astrid deciphers a hidden language of plants, uncovering a truth that challenges humanity's place in nature. Colorado Premiere. (Italy)

title: CITIZEN RUTH: environmental warrior
description: This 96-year-old environmental warrior has the bruises to show from the battles she fought. Called the Mother of Greenbelts, responsible for the Boulder height limit, Ruth Wright continues to fight for the environment. Directed by Pamela Hoge.

title: Corals' Last Stand
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: 300km from Australia lies Scott Reef. This documentary asks whether Australia can afford to exploit this gas reserve, examining the unique marine ecosystem and threats to pristine coral. (Australia)

title: Doesn't Exist in Nature
description: In this satirical mockumentary, naturalist Douglas Nottenborough travels the world in search of a non-native, invasive species of Straw. Environmental themes explored through humor.

title: An Eye for the Land
description: A documentary exploring the connection between people and land, examining how we see, understand, and protect our natural landscapes.

title: Fish for the Future
description: Multiple agencies and volunteers come together after the Palisades Fire in Los Angeles to rescue an endangered fish population before they are wiped out by an upcoming mudslide.

title: Fly Chicks
description: Fly Chicks explores fly fishing through a feminist lens. The film follows three fly fisherwomen and their relationship with the river, the sport, and their identities.

title: Free to Grow
description: Rural Oregon families have fought aerial herbicide spraying by the forestry industry for over 50 years. A chronicle of their ongoing battle for environmental justice.

title: From Flames to Change
description: The 2020 wildfires in Colorado remind us of what's to come if we don't act. This documentary explores the connection between climate change and increasingly destructive wildfires.

title: Global Warning
description: A documentary examining the urgent realities of climate change and its global impact on communities, ecosystems, and our shared future.

title: Hoʻomalu ʻĀina Maui
description: A documentary exploring the deep connection between the Hawaiian people and their land on Maui, examining traditional stewardship practices and the fight to protect sacred natural places.

title: Homes for Hornbills
description: A wildlife conservation documentary following efforts to protect and provide habitat for endangered hornbill species, examining the critical role these birds play in forest ecosystems.

title: Journey Beyond The Grid
description: A documentary exploring life off the electrical grid, following individuals and communities who have chosen sustainable, self-sufficient lifestyles.

title: Legion 44
description: A documentary following the 44th Legion firefighting crew and their heroic efforts battling wildfires, examining the human cost of increasingly severe fire seasons.

title: Marine Field Station
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: A documentary taking viewers inside a marine research station where scientists study ocean ecosystems, marine life, and the impacts of climate change on our seas.

title: Nature. People. Harmony.
description: A documentary exploring the essential balance between human civilization and the natural world, featuring stories of communities working to live in harmony with their environment.

title: Oceanbone
description: A documentary exploring ocean health and marine ecosystems, examining the vital role oceans play in sustaining life on Earth and the threats they face from human activity.

title: OUTLIER: Common
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: A documentary exploring environmental themes through the lens of what we consider 'common' in nature, examining how overlooked species and ecosystems are essential to our planet's health.

title: Outside The Frame
description: A documentary examining environmental issues from unexpected perspectives, challenging viewers to look beyond the obvious and see the interconnected nature of our ecological challenges.

title: Project Deer: Bridging Roads & Wildlife
description: A documentary examining innovative solutions to reduce wildlife-vehicle collisions, following efforts to create wildlife crossings that allow animals to safely navigate human infrastructure.

title: Regenerative Ag in the Northern Great Plains
description: A documentary exploring regenerative agriculture practices in the Northern Great Plains, showcasing farmers and ranchers who are restoring soil health and sequestering carbon.

title: Save the Farm, Save the Future
description: A documentary about the fight to preserve family farms and sustainable agriculture in the face of industrial farming, urban sprawl, and climate change.

title: Shaped by Ice
description: A documentary exploring how glaciers and ice have shaped our planet's landscapes, ecosystems, and civilizations, while examining the rapid disappearance of ice in a warming world.

title: Snk'mip Dig Deeper
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: A documentary following indigenous-led environmental efforts, exploring traditional ecological knowledge and the fight to protect ancestral lands and waters.

title: SPILLOVER - Planet of Viruses
description: A documentary examining the connection between environmental destruction, habitat loss, and the emergence of zoonotic diseases that spill over from wildlife to humans.

title: Stone Biter: Saving the Arctic Sea Forests
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: A documentary about efforts to protect Arctic kelp forests, the vital marine ecosystems threatened by climate change, and the scientists working to save them.

title: Tipping Points are Irreversible
description: A documentary exploring climate tipping points - the critical thresholds beyond which changes become irreversible, and the urgent need to act before we cross them.

title: Trade Secret
description: A documentary investigating the hidden environmental costs of global trade, exposing how trade agreements and corporate practices impact communities and ecosystems worldwide.

title: Transitions
description: A documentary exploring the transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy, following communities, industries, and individuals navigating the shift to a sustainable future.

title: Upstream, Downriver: Uniting for Water Justice
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: A documentary about communities along rivers fighting for clean water, examining connections between upstream actions and downstream impacts, and movements for water justice.

title: Valley Under Fire
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: A documentary chronicling devastating wildfires that swept through a valley community, exploring resilience, recovery, and the increasing threat of extreme fire events.

title: We Are Made from the Land
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: A documentary exploring the deep spiritual and cultural connection between indigenous peoples and their ancestral lands, and the fight to protect these sacred places.

title: We Can't See the Sunset
description: A documentary examining the effects of air pollution and environmental degradation, exploring communities where smog and haze have made clear skies a distant memory.

title: What The River Knows
venue: Lookout Mountain Theater @ Green Center (CSM), Golden
description: A documentary exploring the wisdom held by rivers - the stories of communities along their banks, ecosystems they support, and lessons about living in balance with nature.

title: Women of Carbon
description: A documentary following women leaders in climate science and carbon reduction efforts, highlighting their innovative work to address the climate crisis and inspire the next generation.

title: 2389: Coming Home
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Two humans, a scientist and a soldier from Martian colony, come to Earth destroyed by climate change and resource wars, to find out if it is livable once again; during the research they decide to alter their findings and prevent repopulation.

title: A Letter of Last Resort
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: A man who hand-built a bomb shelter deals with the grief of losing his wife and child to nuclear warfare.

title: Across the Blue Line
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Retired police officer Marvin Johnson is a law biding citizen. But when his goddaughter goes missing and the system he swore an oath to fails to help him, he decides to take matters into his own hands.

title: Amarre (Love Spell)
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Marco, an insecure thirty-something desperate to win over Paola, a coworker, turns to a sorcerer in a Mexican market for a love-binding spell. However, after the ritual, he is horrified to discover that a demon clings to his shoulders.

title: Boiling Point
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Just when he's reached rock bottom, Giacomo receives a mysterious invitation with an alluring guarantee. But when the promising evening becomes complicated, he is faced with a moral obligation to demand satisfaction.

title: Broken Reality
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: In 2025, eco-activist Anya discovers a mysterious melody hidden in the piano that transports her to a dystopian future. There, she encounters a sinister version of herself and uncovers a world where her friends are in danger.

title: Cat Cam
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: When two cat owners decide to put up pet cameras in their new home while they're away on a trip, they soon make a terrifying discovery as to why their cat has been acting so strange.

title: Cat-Tastrophe
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: A cat, through its catastrophic antics, inspires a villainous inventor to devise her most evil plan yet. 3D animated slapstick comedy.

title: Cell Buddies
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Sam, a grumpy raccoon is stuck sharing a cell with Bob, a sweet but dim manatee. Sam hatches an escape plan. In their chaotic jailbreak Sam's hardened edges soften as Bob's loyalty shines.

title: Croc Topic
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: An awkward crocodile father tries to connect with his adopted bird child through clothes shopping, they then bond over the child's true taste in clothes.

title: Don't Bury It
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Dumped by his girlfriend and fired from his job as a gravedigger, Doug's mental health spirals downwards, and he begins burying his problems, quite literally, in his garden.

title: Downsized
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: On his last day of work, a software engineer attempts to salvage the digital remains of his wife before being discovered by his coworker.

title: Dreamland Awaits
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: The story follows Josh, a seasoned but troubled detective hardened by 20 years of confronting life's darkest corners. When his wife and two daughters are kidnapped by a mysterious figure, Josh is forced into a harrowing game of survival.

title: Dying To Meet You
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: A flighty liberal girl brings home her zombie boyfriend to meet her parents. The girl's mother must keep the peace between the girl and her father, a close-minded conservative.

title: Final Broadcast
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: As the world teeters on the brink of nuclear catastrophe, a television studio keeps broadcasting what might be the final show ever aired. A darkly satirical chamber drama unfolding in real time.

title: I'M NOT WORK ANYMORE
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: One day, while Seyfo is herding his sheep, one of them strays from the flock. As he follows it, what he witnesses leaves him stunned. This short film tells the story of how that moment changes Seyfo's life forever.

title: In Half
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Through a child's imagination it tells the journey of a man who after falling prey to his fears, must cross a strange world full of magic, where he will be confronted with his own fears and conflicts from the past.

title: Mannequined
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: In a world where people sometimes turn into mannequins, Ally struggles to maintain a relationship with her boyfriend Tom.

title: Neon Blue
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: After a devastating loss, a grieving boy forms an unlikely bond with a reprogrammed robot in a world on the verge of war. As they journey through a crumbling neon-lit wasteland, the pair forge their own version of family.

title: Now You Don't
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Magic Man, a washed up con artist, flourishes under Lil Miss' tutelage.

title: Oldest and Newest Places on Earth
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Is it possible to travel to the oldest and newest places on Earth? A journey of 10,000 miles and 4 billion years, telling the story of a planet that's constantly remaking itself.

title: One For The Road
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: A lone traveler on a somber journey encounters an unlikely companion while repairing a flat tire. The man he finds appears to be another down-on-his-luck motorist, but that fate may soon change.

title: Powder Monkey
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Chaos ensues when a monkey is mistakenly hired to work the cannons of a pirate ship.

title: Rotten Apple
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: A truly groundbreaking docu-drama, 'Rotten Apple' is an alarming exposé on the dark epidemic of grooming and sexual assault in public schools and the eminent ripple effect.

title: See You Later
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: A man bids farewell to his father at his funeral.

title: Spectacular By Comparison
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: A candid look at Scorpiusfest's turbulent 2023, following director Steffon's personal and professional struggles as he and a devoted filmmaker community rally toward the triumphant 2024 event.

title: Stay
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: When was the first and last time you uttered the phrase 'I love you'? Stay delves into the concept of remorse and examines the diverse manner in which individuals grapple with this emotion.

title: Structural Theory of a Broken Bowl
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: A DID system going through a breakup with their partner has a falling out with a friend after discovering that the friend has a crush on them.

title: Symptoms May Include Death
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: In this horror-romantic-comedy, a young couple's love is put to the test in the midst of a peculiar zombie pandemic. Facing bizarre symptoms, mood swings and bloody chaos, the two must survive the week together.

title: The Axe Forgets
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Inspired by a true story. In 1888 James S. Jameson, heir to the Jameson Whiskey dynasty, returns to Ireland after a year long expedition to the Congo. Things start to unravel as he attempts a return to normality.

title: The Beneath
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Haunted by pressure and self-doubt, young model Lone retreats to her garden, her only refuge from a world that consumes her. But when a mysterious underground creature begins destroying her sanctuary, Lone must confront something far darker.

title: The Black Dog
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: While suffering from insomnia a young woman sees a black dog no one else can see. Hoping her sleep issues will resolve she tries to continue with her life but the black dog remains an increasingly present and threatening presence.

title: The Camcorder
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: While clearing out a warehouse a man finds a camcorder that can see into the past.

title: The Family Photo
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: What happened after an Earth astronaut left a family photo on the moon fifty-plus years ago? This animated short explores the butterfly effect of such an action.

title: The Snake and The Whale
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Over the past fifty years, four federal dams impounding the Lower Snake River in Washington State have been identified as the root cause for the demise of all of Idaho's anadromous fish.

title: The Visitor
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Karim, a sharp tongued but slightly shady shop owner is visited by Azrael, the Angel of Death. What begins as a sceptical exchange turns into a surreal battle of wits, as Karim scrambles to outtalk fate.

title: To Write The Ending
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: When a street poet finds a typewriter that allows him to write the future, he uses it to try and find love.

title: Unstable: A Ponytale
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: A girl named Sydney picks a crazed pony with a mean streak. The insane pony tries everything to shake her determination; through the bucking, biting, and crashing, the little girl's smile never wanes.

title: When Life Gives You a Lawnmower
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: Things go awry as 1950s couple Dick and Brenda prepare for company.

title: Whispers Beyond Bars
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: When a young pregnant woman discovers a hidden journal among her grandmother's keepsakes, she uncovers the story of an incarcerated mother navigating pregnancy behind bars.

title: Why We Ride
venue: The Dairy Arts Center, 2590 Walnut Street, Boulder
description: This short documentary explores the experiences of women who cycle, particularly within the Denver community. It highlights the initial intimidation and safety concerns many face as a minority in the cycling world.
